definitions.definition: To stain or tarnish (somebody) with dishonor.
To debase by distorting the real nature of (something).
Unclean; covered with or containing unpleasant substances such as dirt or grime.
definitions.example: Despite a walk in the rain, my shoes weren't too dirty.

definitions.definition: That makes one unclean; corrupting, infecting.
definitions.example: Don't put that in your mouth, dear. It's dirty.

definitions.definition: Morally unclean; obscene or indecent, especially sexually.
definitions.example: At the reception, Uncle Nick got drunk and told dirty jokes to the bridesmaids.

definitions.definition: Dishonourable; violating accepted standards or rules.
definitions.example: He might have scored, but it was a dirty trick that won him the penalty.
I won't accept your dirty money!
You need to tune that guitar: the G string sounds dirty.
The old flag was a dirty white.

definitions.definition: Containing data needing to be written back to memory or disk.
definitions.example: Occasionally it reads the sector into a dirty buffer, which means it needs to sync the dirty buffer first.

definitions.definition: Carrying illegal drugs among one's possessions or inside of one's bloodstream.
definitions.example: None of y'all get into my car if you're dirty.

definitions.definition: Used as an intensifier, especially in conjunction with "great".
definitions.example: He lives in a dirty great mansion.

definitions.definition: Of an alcoholic beverage, especially a cocktail or mixed drink: served with the juice of olives.
Of food, indulgent in an unhealthy way.
definitions.example: The waiter served dirty burgers to the customers.
